question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
If $\begin{vmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{vmatrix} = 5,$ then find
\[\begin{vmatrix} a - c & b - d \\ c & d \end{vmatrix}.\]
inference:
Solution:
We can expand the determinant on the right-hand side as
\[\begin{vmatrix} a - c & b - d \\ c & d \end{vmatrix} = (a - c)d - c(b - d) = ad - cd - cb + cd = ad - cb.\]We can expand the determinant on the left-hand side as
\[\begin{vmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{vmatrix} = ad - bc.\]Since this determinant is equal to 5, $ad - bc = 5.$  Hence, $ad - cb = \boxed{5}.$
Final Answer: $\boxed{5}$. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth:
Since $\begin{vmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{vmatrix} = 5,$ $ad - bc = 5.$  Then
\[\begin{vmatrix} a - c & b - d \\ c & d \end{vmatrix} = (a - c)d - (b - d)c = ad - bc = \boxed{5}.\](Why does this make sense geometrically?)
